Recap: Michelle and Tony get angry at Danny for not telling her about Robbie, who shows up at the barbecue. She tells Danny how upset she is about not remembering her son or feeling anything for him. She feels pressured when they have the flag ceremony and her name is mentioned several times by Rick and Ross. She and Tony leave on his motorcycle, as Danny calls after her. Also at the bbq: Cassie is annoyed that Reva asked Jeffrey to look into her credit card problem and that he's staying in town. Edmund offers Joey a job helping to fix up the farm. Lizzie is annoyed by that and tells Joey that Tammy is going to the dance with Remy. Remy asks Tammy to go to the dance so he can do some teen research. Rick chats with Phillip about Olivia and wonders why they're still married. Gus and Alexandra worry about what Darci will tell Frank. Darci tells Frank everything about her past, including that Brad was one of her customers. She doesn't specifically mention Gus or Alex's names. Frank tells his family that he is going to re-examine the antimonious case and that Darci has agreed to marry him. Gus tells Alex she's on her own; he won't help her keep Frank in the dark. Sandy and Marina get Alan's password and hack into his computer. Bill and Olivia kiss a lot and end up in bed but don't make love. She stops it because she wants to focus on taking over Spaulding. They agree to split the company 50/50.
Transcript: robbie: Mommy, mommy, mommy!
Reva: You two doing okay?
Edmund: Fine, thank you.
Cassie: You have that look on your face.
Reva: What look?
Cassie: The look that you did something I'm not going to like.
Reva: I talked to jeffrey o'neill about your credit card problems. I wanted to help.
Cassie: I wanted jeffrey o'neill out of my life. And he was almost gone. Thanks for bringing him back in.

Jeffrey: If you've been using cassie winslow's credit cards-- and I'm pretty sure you have been-- i want you to stop immediately. No more playing princess. No more gallivanting around europe. If you cross me on this, you will regret it.
Alexandra: What is it, gus?
Gus: It's just... If darci is telling frank what i think she is, we could be in a lot of trouble.
Harley: What's so interesting about my brother?
Alexandra: We were just remarking how happy he looks.
Harley: Yes, well, love will do that to you.
Alexandra: You know, that's exactly why I'm excited and thrilled about planning your wedding. I want the whole thing to come out without a hitch. (Laughter)
gus: Don't we all?
Frank: Listen, listen. Don't say a word. Don't say one word, okay? Don't answer the question right now.
Darci: Frank, stop. Stop.
Frank: I just want you to think about it, because marriage is a very big step.
Darci: Frank, look. There's a whole bunch of things i need to say to you and i have no idea how to say it. I just want to turn myself inside out, tell you everything i know.
Frank: Are you talking about your old friend vinnie salerno?
Darci: And brad green. But that's not everything. There's more. There's someone else involved, someone who's gotten away scot- free.
Olivia: Aren't you tired of letting your fate rest in other peoples' hands?
Bill: Maybe we should do something about that.
Olivia: Let's do that. Let's free ourselves. Happy independence day, bill.
Robbie: You're home, mommy.
Danny: Hey, buddy?
Michelle: Hey. My son.
michelle: You are so big.
Danny: Yeah, he is. He's growing like a weed, aren't you, champ? Huh?

Michelle: Well, you are cute, huh? I bet you missed your mommy a lot, didn't you? Well, your daddy didn't even tell me that you were going to be here today. But then again, your daddy didn't tell me a lot of things.
Tony: You know what, little guy? What do you say? You want to go hang out by the pool with me? Huh? No? You sure?
Michelle: Okay? All right. You want to come with me? All right, you come with me. Let's go.

Tony: I told you. Didn't i? I told you that this was going to be bad news. Danny, when I went along with keeping robbie from michelle, you told me that you would find a way to make it work out. Does this look like it's working?
Danny: You think I wanted it to happen like this?
Tony: Well, this is what happens every time you control a situation.
Michelle: Here's your dad. He wants me to do the mommy kiss, but I don't really know what that means.
Danny: The mommy kiss? Well, yeah, the mommy kiss. You know what the mommy kiss is, right? It's the eskimo kiss, the butterfly kiss, hang like a bat and nurfle the belly. Yeah?
Michelle: Nurfle. Okay. Yeah.
Danny: Nurfle. Nurfle. It's a raspberry on the tummy. Right, mommy?
Michelle: All right, let me try this out. (Blows raspberry) all right, let me guess. I did it wrong, right?
Danny: Aw. Well, that's okay.
Michelle: You know what, tiger? You are right. Mommy didn't do it right and that is because there's a good reason for that. It's because your mommy isn't really here right now.
Gus: Hey. Did you talk to darci at all today? The party?
Harley: Not as much as you. Why?
Gus: I don't know. No reason. Just...
Harley: Why? Do you think something is wrong?
Gus: Oh, I don't know. I just don't know. I mean...
Harley: Then why ask about it? I mean, why are either one of you asking about darci?
Alexandra: Well, because she seemed a little upset.
Gus: Yeah.
Harley: Yeah, and?

Alexandra: Well, I mean, after all, we're all connected, aren't we? Come on. I mean, I care for buzz, buzz cares for frank, and if something's bothering darci and it upsets frank, then buzz gets all concerned. As a matter of fact, there he is. Excuse me.
Gus: Okay.
Harley: What the heck was that? What, is she about to launch into "kumbayah"? We're all connected? Since when?
Gus: Honey, just relax. Come on, it's a party. Lighten up. We were just looking over there at frank and darci, wondering if they were okay.
Harley: Well, i can tell you what's going on over there. Darci probably just wants to have a good time, and frank is so busy obsessing over a case that is already closed. That's all.
Gus: I'm going to try the potato salad.
Darci: Frank, i've always imagined what you might look like if I were to tell you everything.
Frank: Okay, look, darci, you were a prostitute. I get that.
Darci: Are you disgusted?
Frank: No, I'm not disgusted. I'm disappointed. I'm disappointed that you waited until now to tell me all this.
Darci: I want to marry you. I want to be your wife.
Frank: I want to marry you, too. Look, we can deal with this. I can deal with it. But you've got to promise me from this time on, you've just got to be honest with me.
Darci: I will, I will. I promise, i promise.
Frank: I'm just a little surprised. I mean, why are you coming to me now about this brad green case? What do you know about it?
Darci: I worked for vinnie, as you know. We spent some time in europe, and while we were there, one of my regulars was brad green. Frank, please, please try not to think about it.
Frank: Yeah, well, I'm trying all right. Look, go on about vinnie and brad green. Go ahead.
Darci: And alexandra spaulding.
Gus: I didn't really hear much, but I think we're all right.
Alexandra: Oh.
Buzz: You two seem to be getting along.
Alexandra: Yes, well, given time i'm irresistible.
Buzz: You don't have to tell me.
Alexandra: Oh, buzz cooper. How come you can always manage to make me feel a little bit better about myself?
Buzz: We all have our missions in life. It's a good thing, you two getting along.
Alexandra: Yeah. After all, i did try to keep him out of the family. Anyway, I'm realizing he's a real spaulding.
Buzz: That could go either way.
Alexandra: (Laughs) so far so good. (Laughter and screaming)
alan: All right, all right, all right. Working hard, sandy?
Sandy: It's a holiday, boss.
Joey: Yeah, boss, we're having some fun. But what you don't actually see is all the work we're doing.
Alan: What sort of work.
Remy: Recon, baby.
Joey: Yeah. We're checking out the youth market, seeing what people spend their disposable cash on.
Lizzie: Yeah, we've got a really great idea.
Alan: And what have you discovered?
Joey: A waterproof mp-3 player.
Lizzie: And he's got it all figured out. Tell him all about it.
Joey: Okay, check it out, boss. Ready? Surfers, swimmers, people who just want to hang out at the beach, right?
Alan: Mm-hmm.
Joey: You take your tunes with you and you don't have to worry about getting them messed up.
Lizzie: So it's waterproof!
Shayne: I think he got that, lizzie.

Alan: Joey, do you see that young man in the hot tub over there with the headsets on? Also the young lady next to him. They think your idea is wonderful. As a matter of fact, they went to the store and purchased those. Well, very good work. Congratulations. You've just gotten our company sued for patent infringement.
Lizzie: But grandpa, joey has a lot of great ideas.

Alan: Elizabeth, I must be honest with you. It terrifies me to think that your generation-- all of you-- are the future to this great nation. Now, if you will excuse me, i must go and prepare for that inevitable day when you will all take over.
Marina: He's so supportive.
Cassie: We need to talk, okay?
Jeffrey: What?
Cassie: Reva did not have my permission to get you involved in my problems, so i don't want your help at all. Okay?
Jeffrey: Oh. Well, I already made a few calls.
Cassie: Well, did you find anything out?
Jeffrey: Not yet. You know, I don't tell you how to run your hotel and I could, so why don't you just let me do my job, okay, and relax?
Cassie: Just so you remember, I never asked you. Okay?
Jeffrey: Okay, you never asked me. By the way, speaking of the hotel, i hope you haven't booked my room.
Cassie: Why? Aren't you leaving?
Jeffrey: Uh-uh. Something came up. I'll be sticking around.
jeffrey: I'm sorry. Excuse me.
Cassie: I thought you couldn't wait to leave. Why stay now?
Jeffrey: Well, something came up at work, okay? I had to do a little cleanup. I did you a favor. Some might say a "thank you" would be in order.
Cassie: You don't want me to thank you. You want me to owe you so you can dig your way back into my life again.
Jeffrey: Trust me, that's the last thing i want.
Rick: Still no olivia?
Phillip: No. I told you, this is not high on her list of priorities. She's too busy trying to come up with new and interesting ways to make me look like hannibal lecter.
Rick: I see. Phillip, why don't you just look around? Look around.
Phillip: And what am i looking for?
Rick: Me and mel, gus and harley, josh and reva. I mean, what do these couples have in common?
Phillip: I can't imagine where you're going with this.
Rick: Do you want to be happy? I mean, do you want to have a normal marriage and a normal life?
Phillip: No. My priorities have changed.
Rick: Why are you guys staying together if you're both miserable? I don't understand.
Phillip: At the moment, for emma's sake. I'm doing what needs to be done.
Rick: That doesn't make any sense.
Phillip: It may not right now, but it will soon. I have big plans for olivia.
Bill: You know, if anybody saw us right now, they'd say we have a lot in common.
Olivia: They'd be right.
Bill: Mm-hmm. We both want control. We both want power.
Olivia: We both love a challenge.
Bill: Mm-hmm.
Olivia: You thought you had the upper hand. Led me on, pretended to be my partner against phillip and then you turned me away. Huh?
Bill: Well, you know I just wanted to see how far you'd go.
Olivia: And has that question been answered?
Bill: Not yet.
Olivia: Do you know what it feels like? Real power? I've been close to it.
Bill: Yeah?
Olivia: You can feel it coming off somebody's body. It's electrifying. It's like gravity shifting when they walk in the room. It's not unlike...
Bill: Love?
Olivia: That nasty little four-letter word. I am a married woman, you know that.
Bill: Since when does that matter?
Olivia: Since my husband put a tail on me and wants to know everything i'm doing and who i'm doing it with.
Bill: Well, i'll tell you something: I'm sure phillip's spy is outside right now trying to look for the best angle for pictures.
Olivia: You're right. Let's give him one.

Alan: Look, have the people in your department stop crunching numbers, all right? I want creative results. Oh, listen, before you go, i want you to set up the account. And use the same password as we always use: The initials of every one of my grandchildren.
Marina: I've got to talk to my partner for just one second. Strictly business. It's the grandchildren. Alan's password. It's the initials of all the grandkids.
Sandy: No. It can't be that easy. "L" for lizzie.
Marina: Actually, he calls her elizabeth.
Sandy: Okay, "e." "J" for james. "Z" for zach.
Marina: And his name is alan.

Sandy: Okay. You learn something new every day. And emma. "E" for emma. So ejae or some combination thereof. And we can hack into his personal files, his financial stuff. All we need to know is what kind of message we want to leave.
Marina: Leave that to me.
Remy: Congratulations, tammy winslow. You've been officially recognized as the most depressing person at this party. And I'm not helping, am I? Is he really worth being this miserable?
Tammy: People keep saying that by the time i'm, like, 25, I'm going to look back on this and wonder why i was so pathetic.
Remy: Uh-huh.
Tammy: But for now...
Remy: He's worth it.
Tammy: It's not like I was picturing us with kids in an suv, but... I can't stop thinking about this dance.
Remy: You don't have to be the one whimpering. Not if you let me take you. The offer still stands. But I bet you've probably had a dozen offers by now, anyway.
Tammy: No. Just you.
Remy: Well, guys are intimidated. But not me.

Michelle: Hey, buddy. What i meant before when i said "mommy is not here," is that i know mommy is acting a little funny. She's not really mommy. And that's because i've been sick and i kind of forgot a few things. But I'm going to get better. I am, I really am. Don't worry about that, okay? Promise. Because there's a lot of people here that love you and they're going to help me remember. Okay?

Tony: Listen, hey. Little man, why don't you and me, why don't we go in there and we find some ice cream? What do you say about that? Or, actually, look... Here, come here. There's marina, your friend marina. We can go say hi to her. Do you want to do that? Because they've got a lot of stuff to talk about.
Danny: It's okay, buddy. Go ahead. Go with tony, and I'll come find you in a few minutes, and we'll go for a swim. Okay?
Robbie: I love you, mommy.
Tony: Okay. Come on. Let's go, let's go.
Danny: Michelle, I'm sorry. I didn't want it to happen like this. I really didn'T.
Michelle: What the hell is wrong with you? Coming up on "guiding light."
Olivia: Powerful men have risked everything for me.
Bill: Well, maybe i'm looking for another kind of risk.
Olivia: Good. Then let's get down to business.
Michelle: Are you leaving?
Tony: Yeah.
Michelle: I'm coming with you.
Tony: It's not a good idea, michelle. Just stay here.
Danny: Hey, you guys? Have you seen michelle?
Danny: Michelle, I'm sorry. If you'll let me explain...
Michelle: So, that's what you've got? That's what you've got for me? How about "michelle, this is your son, robbie."
Danny: I didn't want to tell you yet. I didn't want to hurt you or robbie.
Michelle: Yeah, and that didn't hurt a bit, danny. Did it? Is that what our marriage was like? You making decisions for me all the time?
Danny: No, of course not. It's just that the other night you got so upset when you came across his teddy bear.
Michelle: Yeah, right. So you decided to ambush me with my own child?
Danny: That's what I was trying to protect you from, michelle...
Michelle: I don't need your protection, okay? I need you to be honest.
Danny: All right, that's fair. I just thought that you... The old you wouldn't want robbie to see you like this.
Michelle: (Sighs) me. Me.
Danny: What?

Michelle: "Old me," "new me." Danny, no, no. There's just me, okay? There's no "real" michelle hiding up here waiting for you to pull the right lever and she's going to pop out. How old is he? How old is our son?
Danny: Three. His birthday is march 8.
Michelle: He's beautiful. I picked him up and I held on to him. I touched his hair and smelled him and touched his skin and i felt nothing. I gave birth to that kid. How can I feel nothing?
Danny: Michelle. He doesn't need to know.
Michelle: That little boy needs a mother, not an actor. Wow. Sometimes I don't even know how i could have been with someone like you. Just go... Go take your son for a swim.
Reva: Should I just pretend i'm not here?
Tony: No. Why?
Reva: You seem bothered.
Tony: Reva, tell me something, please, huh? Tell me how it is that when you think someone is so smart they continuously make stupid decisions, every single time. Why is that?
Reva: You're not talking about me, right? (Laughs)
tony: No, no.
Reva: Well, then maybe it would help if you did tell me who we were talking about.
Tony: Who do you think, reva? Huh?
Reva: Danny and michelle?

Tony: Yeah, that's right. You know, I just... I hate being here. I don't know why i come to this party. Every year it's the same. People smile, they're miserable. It makes no sense for me to be here. I can't stand this.
Reva: What happened?
Tony: What didn't happen? All right, fine. Michelle saw robbie for the first time, as far as I'm concerned, in front of everybody here.
Reva: She didn't remember him?
Tony: Danny's trying to run the whole situation, manage things and this is how it ends up?
Reva: Michelle told me that the breakthrough that she had was a fake, that she really isn't remembering things.

Tony: Yeah, well, welcome to the santos show, reva. Starring danny and michelle santos. Danny pretends to be honest with michelle, pretends that everything is going to turn out to be okay, and then you watch michelle pretend that it's working. And you know what? It ends with both of them messing people's lives up. It's brilliant, don't you think?
Olivia: Wait a minute. No, no, no, no, no, no.
Bill: What, what, what, what, what, what, what?
Olivia: Don't unbutton anymore.
Bill: You want to do it, don't you? Don't you? That's fine by me.
Olivia: It's a mistake.
Bill: What?
Olivia: It's so easy to get caught up in the moment.
Bill: Then why don't we? Why don't we?
Olivia: Because, because. I've let this kind of thing get in the way of my goals in the past. And you, you just lost the love of your life and i'm in a sham of a marriage...
Bill: Isn't that a perfect reason to make each other feel better? Come over here.
Olivia: Oh, god, it would be so simple to sleep with you. And I could even use it to my advantage.
Bill: (Laughs) you think so?

Olivia: Oh, yeah, i know that i could. But it's not what I want. It's not what I want, okay? I want to take over spaulding, and I want to crush phillip, and i don't want him running my daughter's life. Using sex as a weapon is going to get either one of us only so far.
Bill: All right. Well, you know, I've got news for you. I would have slept with you and it wouldn't have changed anything about our deal or lack thereof.
Olivia: I doubt it. Powerful men have risked everything for me.
Bill: Well, maybe i'm looking for another kind of risk.
Olivia: Good. Well, let's get down to business.
Bill: Yeah?
Edmund: Cassie, jeffrey o'neill is the da. If you want the identity theft to stop, i don't see the harm in hiring the top legal man in town to take care of the matter.
Cassie: I cannot believe that's coming from you.
Edmund: Well, my dislike for him doesn't preclude using him for a job. I'm just surprised he's still in town.
Cassie: Well, nobody else wants him. Not that we want him, either.
Edmund: Do you think he's trying to stay connected here?
Cassie: Why else would he stay?
Edmund: Tammy looks so sad. How are things going on the joey lupo front?
Cassie: He's still pushing her away.
Edmund: Well, i think i should have a talk to the man.
Cassie: And i think she will kill you.
Edmund: Well, undoubtedly. But I think in the future, when she looks back and of course i'm dead, she'll thank me for all this.
Cassie: Well, then give it a shot.
Edmund: Excuse me.
Remy: I already told you, this isn't a charity date.
Tammy: Remy, you're in college. And you're my friend, okay? I can't do that to you. Going back to high school would make you a loser.
Remy: No, no. Not if i'm helping out a friend.R
tammy: See! I knew it. This is my pity party. No, thanks. I'm not going.
Remy: Helping you out isn't the only reason why I want to take you, tammy.
Tammy: Well, what could possibly be the reason, then?
Remy: We're supposed to research the teen market, figure out what they'll buy. This is... The high school dance is a marketing study. I need to go. I barely remember my teens.
Tammy: Okay. Then i'll let you know if I need a date, old man.
Reva: You completely overhauled the entire computer tracking system at lewis construction. We gave you a job. You're family, yet you want to go and work for alan spaulding and let him abuse you?
Joey: (On helium): Mrs. Lewis, i've worked construction before and this is way better.
Reva: Joey, you are crazy. What is better about it? Name one thing.
Joey: Okay. We get to spend all day indoors during the summer. We don't have to wake up at 4:00 in the morning. We don't have to lay bricks all day long.
Reva: Let me tell you something: Manual labor builds character.
Edmund: Is that why the sons of bricklayers become doctors?
Reva: This coming from you, the prince off his pea.
Edmund: If you two don't mind, I'm going steal mr. Lupo for a moment. Joey?
Reva: No more helium. (Laughs)
edmund: I couldn't help overhearing. You've worked construction?
Joey: Yeah. And I hated every minute of it. Mrs. Lewis is nice and everything, but she's a nut. No one likes hammering nails all day long.
Edmund: Well, i'm renovating a farm and i could use some help.
Joey: Great. So hire a guy.

Edmund: That's what i'm doing. Joey, if there's one thing i've learned, american teenagers always need more money. You can make your own hours and we'll work around the spaulding competition. Oh, right. And, joey, it's a very big farm. You'd never have to see tammy if you didn't want to.
Harley: Can i have some chips?
Buzz: Uh-uh. You'll be too fat for your wedding dress.
Harley: Oh!
Buzz: You know, your soon-to- be husband is actually playing nicely with alexandra these days.
Harley: Yeah, i know. Weird, huh?
Buzz: A little twist. I guess your wedding is bringing them closer together. You know, the spauldings do have control issues. You know that, don't you?
Harley: No. No.
Buzz: I have a very large to- do list for the upcoming nuptials, by the way.
Harley: Actually, daddy, I've been meaning to talk to you about that.
Buzz: Well, now is the time. I envision a big, fat greek wedding, all over.
Harley: You're pulling my leg, aren't you?
Buzz: Right out of the socket. (Laughs) I know; the spauldings are going to give you a fancy gala. I guess I'm okay with it.
Harley: Are you sure?
Buzz: If you're happy.
Harley: You had me feeling guilty there for a minute, you know.
Buzz: You should feel guilty. You're depriving your father of a chance to empty his savings account. So, another spaulding wedding.
Harley: Yeah.
Buzz: Yeah.
Gus: Hey, frank. So, I'm standing over there and... Is everything all right with you and darci?
Frank: Yeah, I think so.
Gus: Yeah?
Frank: Is there something i should know?
Gus: No. No, not at all. I'm just making sure.
Frank: Okay. You know, it's a funny thing about life. Honesty really is the key. And the truth hurts like nothing else, but without it, you've got nothing else.
Harley: I've been working very hard just to accept them, you know? Accept them.
Buzz: You mean you trust them?
Harley: There's no such thing as trusting a spaulding.
Buzz: Even gus?
Harley: Gus is not a spaulding. He's not. No, no, no, no. Gus is the one member of that family i do trust.T(
danny: Michelle? Last year, robbie helped your dad raise the flag, and he's been talking about it ever since. He really wants to stay for the flag ceremony.
Michelle: He wants me to help?
Danny: Yeah. He wants you to be with us if you're up for it.
Michelle: Like I have a choice.
Gus: Yes, frank, honesty is the best policy. Did darci say something to you earlier that upset you?
Frank: Look, man, that's something I just can't share with you, all right, without her permission.
Gus: No, that's cool. I understand.
Frank: But I can share something with you about the antimonious case.
Gus: Frank, you've got to let it go. Come on. Salerno's in jail. Brad green's dead. So is the spaulding drug pipeline.Q the feds have closed this case.
Frank: I understand that, but i also told you that i have a gut feeling and I think there's a lot more there than meets the eye.
Lizzie: Oh, good job! Hey, by the way, i talked to my grandfather about you working, you know, around the pool for some extra money and...
Joey: Oh, about that. I got another job offer.
Lizzie: You do?
Joey: Yeah.
Lizzie: Well, what's more fun than getting free use of the best pool in town?
Joey: Edmund asked me to help out on the farm.
Lizzie: The farm? You want to work on a farm?
Joey: Well, it's better pay and I get to make my own hours.
Lizzie: Yeah, and tammy is there.
Joey: Lizzie, what's up with you? Sometimes you act like we're going out or something?
Lizzie: No, i don't.
Joey: Well, then cut the jealous act.
Lizzie: I'm not jealous. Listen, I could care less. There's no chance for you and tammy anyway. Remy already asked her to the dance.
Joey: Tammy and remy.
Lizzie: She's moving on, just like you.
Gus: Scratch what i said earlier. Frank is going to check out this whole thing, so we have a major problem. Major.
Alexandra: (Sighs)
michelle: So I guess we're going to go gather around that flag. What do you say? All right, little guy. That's the flag right there, right?
Tony: How far are you going to push this, danny? Why can't you give her a break?
Danny: Don't tell me how to handle my wife.
Tony: See, right there, there's that word again.

Rick: First of all, thank you so much for coming. The bauer barbecue is more than a tradition to this family. It just... It just means everything to us, and everybody that's important to us is here, and I can't tell you how much that means to mel and michelle and I that you're all here. There is one person missing, of course. You all know my dad-- our dad. And if he were standing here right now, he would be giving this speech and doing a much better job of it, so i think i need a little help here. So i'd like my father's dearest and closest friend to do the honors. This man, our new mayor, but he's my father's dearest and best friend. (Cheers and applause)çó
ross: I haven't prepared anything.
Buzz: I find that hard to believe.

Ross: Maybe i made a couple of mental notes. Let me start by saying how thankful i am that you are back with us, michelle. And with ed being gone, you are now becoming the heart and soul of this remarkable family. You know, before your father left, I asked him, "why are you going over there to help those people with their seemingly impossible problems? I mean, it's like digging out the grand canyon one spoonful at a time. What are you doing? Why are you going there?" And ed told me, "well, i'm going because I happen to have a spoon." And of late, many people have followed his footsteps, and beyond. Men and women of service. And on this celebration of our independence, let us honor their commitment and let us honor them for answering their call to duty. At home, i think we s]pt strive to follow his example, and ask, "what can we do for those in need?" And when we find out, we do it. And on the following day, we do it again. And so on the occasion of yet another glorious bauer barbecue, allow me to give a toast. To ed bauer, to all those who know the wisdom of what it is to own a spoon... (Laughter) ...And to all of those who serve and sacrifice here and abroad. To america. (Applause) and to michelle. Our daughter has come back to us. (Cheers and applause)
